##Faculty Mentor

Hector Ceniceros

title: Homepage
text:
Welcome to the UCSB SIAM Student Chapter. We seek to facilitate an environment for interdisciplinary research and community at UCSB for our applied mathematics students, as well as students from other departments who are interested in applications of their field to applied and computational mathematics. We are currently planning events for the 2024-2025 academic year and will post a schedule before the start of Fall Quarte 2024. Students from all disciplines are welcome to attend all student chapter events. We welcome both undergraduate and graduate students.

Statement of Inclusivity
We strongly encourage students from all backgrounds to participate in our seminar. We are dedicated to fostering an environment where all students, regardless of socioeconomic background, ethinicity, gender identity, and/or sexual orientation are welcome and encouraged to participate and provide their unique perspective on industrial and applied mathematical topics. If we can be of any help or if we can do anything to foster a more welcoming environment, please reach out to a chapter representative.


Join Our Chapter
If you are interested in joining our chapter events or learning more, please follow our instructions here.

title: Chapter Representatives
text: For inquiries, please reach out to our chapter email.

title: Join Chapter
text:
If you would like to join the chapter and get on our mailing list, please fill out this form.
Chapter members get free SIAM membership! Learn more about the benefits of SIAM membership here. Membership benefits include increased networking, discounts on conference registration and SIAM books, access to SIAM review, and more.

title: Schedule of Events
text:
We will hold our chapter kickoff event on September 30th, in which we will plan events for the rest of the quarter and schedule speakers. Our tentative plan is to discuss applications of optimal transport to computational physics, including theoretical ideas and development of some numerical software. This is subject to change based on our planning meeting. If you have any input on topics to discuss during the year, please attend the kickoff meeting!
